verses.roman:
na vāyaṁ brahma-bandhur
viṣṇur māyāvināṁ varaḥ
dvija-rūpa-praticchanno
deva-kāryaṁ cikīrṣati

synonyms: na—not; vā—either; ayam—this; brahma-bandhuḥ—Vāmanadeva, in the form of a brāhmaṇa; viṣṇuḥ—He is Lord Viṣṇu Himself; māyāvinām—of all cheaters; varaḥ—the greatest; dvija-rūpa—by assuming the form of a brāhmaṇa; praticchannaḥ—is disguised for the purpose of cheating; deva-kāryam—the interest of the demigods; cikīrṣati—He is trying for.
translation: "This Vāmana is certainly not a brāhmaṇa but the best of cheaters, Lord Viṣṇu. Assuming the form of a brāhmaṇa, He has covered His own form, and thus He is working for the interests of the demigods.
